solution.text:
We begin by using the formula \((a+b)^2=a^2+b^2+2ab\)
L.H.S becomes:\(_{{j*j}}_sin^2\theta+_{{k*k}}_cosec^2\theta+2\times\)_{j}_\(\times\)_{k}_\(\times\)sin\(\theta \times cosec\theta+_{{j*j}}_cos^2\theta+_{{k*k}}_sec^2\theta\)+2\(\times\)_{j}_\(\times\)_{k}_\(\timescos\theta \times sec\theta \)
we know sec\( \theta \)=\(1\over cos\theta\) and cosec\(\theta \)=\(1\over sin\theta\)
so L.H.S. becomes: \(_{{j*j}}_(cos^2\theta+sin^2\theta)+2 \times\)_{{j}}_\(\times\)_{{k}}_+2\(\times\)_{{j}}_\(\times\)_{{k}}_+_{{k*k}}_\((cosec^2\theta+sec^2\theta)\)
now we know \(cos^2\theta+sin^2\theta=1\,, cosec^2\theta=1+cot^2\theta\, and\, sec^2\theta=1+ tan^2\theta\)
therefore, L.H.S becomes \(_{{k*k}}_(1+tan^2\theta+1+cot^2\theta)+_{{j*j}}_+4\times _{{j*k}}_\)
\(_{{(4*j*k)+(2*k*k)+(j*j)}}_+_{{2*k*k}}_tan^2\theta+_{{2*k*k}}_cot^2\theta\)
by comparing with R.H.S we can say, t=\(_{{(4*j*k)+(2*k*k)+(j*j)}}_\)

content.text:
In the given expression find the value of \(t\).
\((_{j}_sin\theta+_{k}_cosec\theta)^2 + (_{j}_cos\theta+_{k}_sec\theta)^2=t+_{{k*k}}_tan^2\theta+_{{2*k*k}}_cot^2\theta\)
